newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan takes delivery of second French frigate.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan takes delivery of second French frigate.

text.p: Taiwan has taken delivery of the second of six Lafayette-class missile frigates ordered from France and will commission the radar-evading ship on its October 10 national day, the Central News Agency said on Wednesday.
The 3,600-tonne Hsi Ning frigate arrived in waters off southern Kaohsiung harbour early on Wednesday, according to the state-funded agency, which quoted unnamed military sources.
The advanced frigate would sail to the navy's Tsoying military base later this week to prepare for its commission on national day, it said.
Taiwan maintains it needs such advanced weapons to counter the rapid military modernisation of China, the island's arch rival since the Chinese civil war separated them in 1949.
The first frigate delivered, the Kang Ting, was commissioned in May to celebrate the inauguration of Taiwan's first directly elected president, Lee Teng-hui.
The ships have many surfaces clad in high-tech composite materials that make them far less visible to radar, earning them the nickname of "stealth frigates."
Taiwan ordered the French ships in 1991 before Paris agreed to demands by China to stop arming the island, which Beijing views as a renegade province.
France's acquiescence ended a bitter row with China.

China held war games and unarmed missile tests in the Taiwan Strait in the weeks before Taiwan's March 23 presidential election in what Beijing acknowledged was a bid to intimidate voters against pursuing independence.
Beijing vows to retake Taiwan by force if the island opts for independence.
Taiwan has said the frigates would be armed in Taiwan with U.S.-built, surface-to-air missiles, Taiwan-developed surface-to-surface missiles, and other systems.
The remaining four French frigates along with 60 Mirage 2000-5 fighters ordered from France in early 1993 are due to arrive in coming months.
Media reports have put the price tag for the six frigates at close to US$3 billion, but the Defence Ministry has not confirmed the figure.
Taiwan also is taking delivery in 1996 of the first of 150 F-16 jet fighters purchased in 1992 from the United States over China's strenuous objections.
